Name: Sean
description:
I have been in the farming industry for over a decade, starting my journey
by keeping bees part-time while working as an environmental scientist in
Texas. My passion for sustainable land stewardship led me to transition to
sustainable agriculture and relocate to Central Arkansas. During this time,
I managed organic vegetable production, conducted research, and hosted
workshops for a large non-profit organization. As I learned more about
sustainable farming, I realized its potential to not only reduce
environmental harm but also reverse it, healing the land. While working
with farmers across Arkansas, I observed the significant obstacles they
faced, including the lack of affordable, regionally available, and
scale-appropriate tools and supplies. This realization fueled my dedication
to improving the lives of growers and lowering the barriers to entry into
small-scale sustainable agriculture, which eventually led me to start
Mindful Farmer.

Mindful Farmer specializes in designing and manufacturing tools, high
tunnels, and supplies for small-scale sustainable gardeners and farmers. We
are committed to delivering heirloom-quality, regionally manufactured tools
that prioritize efficiency and ergonomics. In addition, we offer economical
high tunnels and a wide selection of organic soil amendments. At our core,
we aim to empower growers with the essential tools, supplies, and knowledge
they need to thrive, thereby lowering the barriers to entry into farming.
